translation:
The undersigned Captain Roberto G. Bisley, Jerônimo Teixeira de Almeida, and Domingos José de Almeida, wishing to cooperate with all their efforts in the prompt recognition of the Riograndense Republic, have agreed to arm at their own expense a launch to cruise the high seas in the waters at the mouth of Rio Grande, against the vessels of the subjects of the Emperor of Brazil, taking from them, at the same time, all advantages that can be gathered, and for such purposes they mutually commit themselves to the conditions set forth in the following articles:

Article 1 — For the purchase of a launch that will cruise the waters at the mouth of Rio Grande to harass the subjects of the Government of Brazil, its equipment, armament, and advances to the crew, each of the partners is obligated to deliver in Montevideo to partner Captain Roberto Bisley, or to whomever he shall designate, the sum of 750 patacões in hard currency.

Article 2 — The said partner Captain Roberto is responsible for the purchase of the mentioned launch, its equipment and armament, as well as its command, the direction of prizes, and all else pertaining to the corsair operations, according to the Regulation of November 12, 1836, and other instructions received with his letter patent from this Republic; and for the labor of arming and equipping he will demand nothing, but from the prizes, as commander of the corsair, he shall have five percent in addition to the share that corresponds to him as armorer.

Article 3 — Partner Jerônimo is responsible for proceeding to Mostardas as soon as he has notice of the purchase and departure of the corsair launch, to have sentinels on the coast to observe where the prize runs aground, encourage its unloading, dispose of the effects of the cargo, and keep clear records and notices to the other partners.

Article 4 — Partner Almeida is responsible for liaising with the Government of the Republic to obtain the necessary orders and provisions for the protection of the unloading of the prizes, the sale of the goods contained therein, and the payment of those sold to the State, in addition to directing notices to Montevideo.

Article 5 — All prizes containing dry goods or military articles will be sent to Mostardas, to run aground at the contracted point; the commander shall give suitable destination to other prizes, scuttling those which are of no use.

Article 6 — Half of the proceeds of the prizes, after settlement, will be promptly delivered to the commander and captors.

Article 7 — The other half will be delivered to the armorers, who will divide it into equal parts.

Article 8 — Partner Jerônimo is responsible for the effects of the prizes he disposes of, and partner Captain Roberto equally for prizes destined to other points, giving repeated notices.

And in this conforming manner, they sign three copies of this text, so that each partner may keep one.

City of Piratini, January 26, 1839.  
Domingos José de Almeida  
Roberto G. Bisley  
Jerônimo Teixeira de Almeida

Contract of partnership of a corsair.
